newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch think Queen Beatrix should retire at 65.
newsitem.headline: Dutch think Queen Beatrix should retire at 65.

text.p: Some two thirds of Dutch people believe Queen Beatrix should abdicate when she turns 65 in 2003, leaving the throne to her eldest son Willem-Alexander, according to a survey published in Trouw newspaper on Saturday.
Beatrix's mother, Juliana, gave up the throne at the age of 70, but 65 percent of people believe the present queen should stand down five years earlier, Trouw said.
Fifty three percent of those polled said it would be acceptable for Prince Willem-Alexander, who turns 30 on April 27, to cohabit with a woman without marrying her.
Forty three percent said they would not object to the prince choosing to live with a male partner.
Willem-Alexander had a highly publicised romance a few years ago with a law student named Emily Bremers who later went on to work for the Dutch airline KLM.
However, the gossip magazines have carried little substantive news about the prince's love life more recently.
